author: iSazonov
body:
All cmdlets use "PSPath" alias for the "LiteralPath" parameter.

Only the following Diagnostics cmdlets use "PSPath" alias for the "Path" parameter and _should be fixed_:
- **Export-Counter**
- **Get-Event**
- **Import-Counter**

(Also the cmdlet use "PSPath" alias (won't fix):
- Join-Path (haven't "LiteralPath" so it is Okay)
- Start-Process (haven't "LiteralPath" so it is Okay)
- Send-MailMessage (haven't "LiteralPath" so it is Okay)
- Update-Data (haven't "LiteralPath" so it is Okay)
- Set-TraceSource (haven't "LiteralPath" so it is Okay)
- Trace-Command (haven't "LiteralPath" so it is Okay)
- Import-WorkFlow (haven't "LiteralPath" so it is Okay)
- Invoke-Command (haven't "LiteralPath" so it is Okay)
)
title: "PSPath" alias in Diagnostics cmdlets
